subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: A day after Tony Stewart assailed Goodyear for the tires it provided at Atlanta Motor Speedway, three other drivers echoed his complaints — but without the same venom. “I think he went a little overboard,” the four-time series champion Jeff Gordon said. “He kind of made it personal.” Gordon, Greg Biffle and Ryan Newman all tested tires for Goodyear at the newly paved Darlington Raceway on Monday, and all agreed the rubber at Atlanta was not favorable for driving conditions. Goodyear officials participating in Monday’s test refused to comment, and the garage was closed to the news media.
